author: hvitved
body:
Hi,

I came across this when looking at the alerts for this project on LGTM.com (full disclosure: I work on the C# analysis there). The existing check `splitName.Length < 0` is redundant, and I believe it should have been `splitName.Length == 0`, since the constructor of `PSSnapinQualifiedName` expects an array of length 1 or 2.

You can see the original alert on LGTM.com here: https://lgtm.com/projects/g/PowerShell/PowerShell/alerts/?mode=tree&ruleFocus=1506101336231

Best regards,
Tom

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @bergmeister The code is used for modules. If I remember correctly most of SnapIn code already was removed.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @hvitved Please add empty commit with '[Feature]' in the commit header to run all tests.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Ok, thanks. Sorry, this was not clear to me given the surrounding variable names.

title: Fix length check in `PSSnapinQualifiedName.GetInstance()`
